entry.title: Storage issues and potential data loss

link.title: Storage issues and potential data loss

entry.content:
On Friday, we unfortunately experienced some data loss. Currently, we believe that some datasets created in the last two months were affected.

If your data was affected by this, the datasets will still appear in your history, but the data itself will be missing - i.e. if you click on the ‘View’ or ‘Download’ buttons, you will probably encounter an error or a white page.

If you try and run a job using one of the affected datasets as input, the job will fail with an error like ‘Job 7225486’s output dataset(s) could not be read’.

We are working on dealing with the situation and will update this blog-post with more information later today. If you have any questions, feel free to email us at galaxy@informatik.uni-freiburg.de.

We are truly sorry!

Tips for re-creating your histories or re-running your results

  • ensure that your input datasets are still available, re-upload them if needed
  • use the reload button to re-run single tools
  • extract workflows from your history and re-run them again
entry.summary: On Friday, we unfortunately experienced some data loss. Currently, we believe that some datasets created in the last two months were affected.

entry.title: de.NBI Training Infrastructure Feedback from Helena Rasche

link.title: de.NBI Training Infrastructure Feedback from Helena Rasche

entry.content:
We just wrapped up the Galaxy Admin Training week in Barcelona, Spain.

It went absolutely fantastically! We used infrastructure from de.NBI to host the VMs for the training event, students were spread across 40 Ubuntu VMs and we experienced zero issues. The network was fast, everyone had a great time.

Ok, we experienced one issue: everyone was too good at it! We blew through 5 days of content in only 3 due to an amazing group of participants who took to using Ansible immediately and with no issues. We ended up teaching 2 new days worth of contents that we had not initially planned to teach.

The Training Materials have been iterated upon to such a point that everyone can follow them without issue, everything is super well tested and ready to use.

If you want to follow along at home with what we did, check out the schedule from the week.

Thank you from the Galaxy Admin Training team! Helena
entry.summary: We just wrapped up the Galaxy Admin Training week in Barcelona, Spain.

entry.title: ELIXIR-Italy launches Laniakea@ReCaS, a Galaxy “on-demand” platform

link.title: ELIXIR-Italy launches Laniakea@ReCaS, a Galaxy “on-demand” platform

entry.content:
ELIXIR-ITALY has officially announced the Laniakea@ReCaS Call, starting on 10 February 2020. The ELIXIR-ITALY Laniakea@ReCaS Call offers access to Cloud resources to be used for the deployment of on-demand Galaxy instances through the Laniakea platform. Users of the service will be able to configure, launch, and manage their Galaxy instance(s) on the Cloud using a user-friendly interface.

Once deployed, Laniakea Galaxy instances can be operated and administered through the functionalities available to any typical Galaxy instance, for example adding tools, managing users, and designing workflows. Advanced users are also able to access the underlying virtual machine via SSH to fine-tune their configuration as needed. Laniakea can also be employed as a tool publishing platform. That is, tools developers can choose to publish and make new tools available embedding them in a personalized Galaxy instance. See for example PITE-T and VINYL.

European researchers can access Laniakea@ReCaS through an open-ended Call that assigns cloud resources to be used for the service.

Galaxy instances can be customised with several sets of pre-installed tools designed to address the typical needs of some of the most common NGS data analysis pipelines. The sets currently available are:

  • Galaxy Minimal - Standard Galaxy production-grade server, i.e., the software environment is complete of the auxiliary applications needed for best performances, e.g., PostgreSQL database engine, NGINX/uWSGI HTTP server, proftpd FTP server, all pre-configured to work with Galaxy. This is also the baseline configuration of all the other flavours.
  • Galaxy CoVaCS - Workflow for genotypization and variant annotation of whole genome/exome and target-gene sequencing data (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC5800023/).
  • Galaxy GDC Somatic Variant - port of the Genomic Data Commons (GDC) pipeline for the identification of somatic variants on whole exome/genome sequencing data (https://gdc.cancer.gov/node/246).
  • Galaxy RNA Workbench - more than 50 tools for RNA centric analysis (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/28582575).
  • Galaxy Epigen - based on the Epigen project Galaxy server, suited for the analysis of ChIP-Seq data.

New configurations can be designed and added upon request.
entry.summary: ELIXIR-ITALY has officially announced the Laniakea@ReCaS Call, starting on 10 February 2020. The ELIXIR-ITALY Laniakea@ReCaS Call offers access to Cloud resources to be used for the deployment of on-demand Galaxy instances through the Laniakea platform. Users of the service will be able to configure, launch, and manage their Galaxy instance(s) on the Cloud using a user-friendly interface.

entry.title: Laniakea@ReCaS becomes an EOSC Provider
entry.content:
Laniakea@ReCaS is now a European Open Science Cloud provider, thus opening the service to all EOSC users.

The service is available in the EOSC Marketplace here.
entry.summary: Laniakea@ReCaS is now a European Open Science Cloud provider, thus opening the service to all EOSC users.

entry.title: Open collaborative infrastructure to tackle public health emergencies

link.title: Open collaborative infrastructure to tackle public health emergencies

entry.content: The rapid spread of the COVID-19 virus highlights the need for an open analytics environment so that the global research community can collaborate on developing effective countermeasures.
entry.summary: The rapid spread of the COVID-19 virus highlights the need for an open analytics environment so that the global research community can collaborate on developing effective countermeasures.

entry.title: TIaaS Calendar and Stats site
entry.content:
We’ve seen the TIaaS Queue Status receive a lot of positive feedback. Todas Helena added two new features to get a general information about the TIaaS service.

  • a Calendar that shows when TIaaS trainings are booked
  • some Statistics about the TIaaS events

Enjoy!
entry.summary: We’ve seen the TIaaS Queue Status receive a lot of positive feedback. Todas Helena added two new features to get a general information about the TIaaS service.

entry.title: Coronavirus data analysis by University of Freiburg

link.title: Coronavirus data analysis by University of Freiburg

entry.content: The Galaxy platform enables the free and transparent overview of COVID-19 genome informations.
entry.summary: The Galaxy platform enables the free and transparent overview of COVID-19 genome informations.
